channel.title: Cable Tv on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Cable Tv on My New Hugo Site

item.title: It’s Not HBO, It’s UHF
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: I’m going to say it right now—we totally got lucky with our acquisition of the Genesis Storytime video earlier this month, which, while it didn’t bring in millions of views, may be the most impressive thing we’ve ever done. (Nice work, Andrew!) More likely, a hunt for an obscure video will end in tears, possibly a dead end. (We were not the first people to hunt for video of that channel.

item.title: That '70s Interactive TV
item.description: [whitebox] Hey guys, Ernie here with a new writer for Tedium, a guy named Chris Tonn who wanted to talk about an awesome piece of television history that happened in his hometown of Columbus, Ohio. Perhaps it didn’t come to your neck of the woods, but you certainly benefited from it. I’ll let him explain. Thanks all!   [big]Today in Tedium: When Facebook’s Mark Zuckerberg testified about the platform’s privacy concerns in April, one would be forgiven for thinking that this was the first serious lapse in maintaining user data in history.

item.title: The Case Of The Missing Channel
item.description: [whitebox] Hey guys, Ernie here with an epic find from Andrew Egan. He worked really hard on this one and I wanna give him a ton of credit here. Strap in for an epic piece. [big]Today in Tedium: Permanence and importance are at the center of Percy Shelley’s classic poem Ozymandias. “Look upon my works ye mighty and despair,” an ancient king extols from a crumbling statue before the poem concludes.
